definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Vera was in no way moved by either his wealth or fame.
sentences.chinese: 他的财富也好，名声也罢，都不会让维拉动心。

sentences.english: But that thou none lovest is most evident;
sentences.chinese: 可是显然地，你对谁都未曾动心。

sentences.english: His plea unimpressed the vast majority of shareholders present.
sentences.chinese: 他的请求未能使在场的大多数股东动心。

sentences.english: GIO What do you like to see your men and women wearing in the bedroom to turn you on?
sentences.chinese: 在卧室，你喜欢男人或女人穿什么来让你动心？

sentences.english: The good news is that prices are still temptingly low.
sentences.chinese: 好消息是价格仍很低，让人动心。

sentences.english: Even at current prices, a navigation computer is impressive.
sentences.chinese: 即使就当前的价格而吉，导航电脑也足以令人动心。

sentences.english: But even the offer of a car for his use was not enough to entice Dilan.
sentences.chinese: 但即便是给他提供一辆轿车供他用，他也没有动心。

sentences.english: We're often way more into you than we're comfortable letting on.
sentences.chinese: 当我们能舒适安详的在一起时，我会更为你动心。
我是一个容易动心的人。

sentences.english: A boy to chasing girls, she soon.
sentences.chinese: 有男生追女孩，她动心了。

sentences.english: Money-oriented praise Sun Weijun is really beautiful, and even oneself all tempted.
sentences.chinese: 钱串子夸奖孙维君真是漂亮了，连自己都动心了。

sentences.english: He Xuan listened very tempted to encourage ze Ming insists on his dream.
sentences.chinese: 何萱听了很动心，鼓励泽铭坚持他的梦想。

sentences.english: Facing the outside world, Jiang Hai inevitably have a crush.
sentences.chinese: 面对着外面的广阔天地，姜海不可避免地有点动心了。

sentences.english: Not that even my pro-EU stance would cause me to buy a European car.
sentences.chinese: 即便是我的“欧盟情节”也不会让我对买欧洲车动心。

definition: heartbeat/heart rate/(fig.) emotionally affected/aroused (of desire, emotion, interest etc)
to feel a rush of excitement (idiom)
to give up/to admit failure/to drop the matter/to reconcile oneself to loss/to have no more illusions about
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
to treat sb favorably/to view in a new light
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
to look upon/to take a fancy to/to fall for
